comments:
Need to see if this still occurs once we step up to 3.0M5 with workingCopy being
the default.

Cannot subclass javax.swing.JFrame properly.  When you subclass this instead of
seeing the JFrame in the free form suface as the this part
you just see the default puzzle piece.  When you select it the properties are
for a JFrame but there is no graphic.
Frame works OK, JPanel works OK, Dialog works OK
JDialog does not work

This is not as easy as I made out above
When you subclass JFrame it works OK, but if you subclass Object and then
re-subclass
ot to JFrame it doesn't work.  Even when you close and re-open the JVE it shows
a default puzzle piece

  There are two problems:

  Starting with a new run of the IDE:

1.  If has an empty file (extends Object), open it up with JVE, "this" is not
set (with the
    latest code base in CVS).

    If you now add the "extends javax.swing.JPanel" to the class def for example, 
    CodeGen will add the this part.
    But, because the Jave Model will not re-reflect (working copy has changed,
not the 
    file system) a non visual icon will be showen, and NO properties in the PS.

2.  Save the file, and close JVE.
    Now, re-open it.

    we are getting:

I'm changing this to only be about the seeing of the changes while the editor is
open.

The part of not seeing the changes after closing and reopening the editor is a EMF
bug and I have opened a sev 1 against them. (Defect 206735).

This is here so we have a record of while open problem. However, I don't know how
to fix it because we don't have a way of introspecting the working copy, only the
saved copy can be introspected.
Since M1 is now complete these are being retargeted to M2.

With the fix of bug 58439 you get almost what you want without any errors reported.

When you change the superclass, you don't see any change because the class has
not been saved yet, and code parsing doesn't reparse, but no errors.

If you do a reload from scratch you will see a puzzle piece because the file has
not been saved yet.

Now if you save, there is no change because save doesn't cause a reload to
occur. But if you now do a reload, it will all be fine.
1.0M2 is out, so these are now closed in M2.
